title.rendered: About How Often Do You Need Your Air Conditioner Cleaned or Replaced?

content.rendered:
Whether your air conditioning unit is showing any signs of wear or not, it’s a good idea to have it cleaned and services once a year. We recommend getting your AC installation inspected in the spring so that it works at peak energy efficiency during summer – when you need it the most.

As your air conditioner runs, it gathers dirt and dust in main areas that impact its effectiveness, like the condensing coils and air filters. If you don’t get them cleaned, your AC unit can lose 5% of its operating efficiency every year because of this debris buildup.

This means it will fail to cool your house as effectively as it could if it were clean and well-maintained.

Your AC unit works 24×7 to keep your house cool so naturally it needs regular maintenance to perform optimally.

Benefits of Regular AC Repair and Maintenance

Here are some advantages of performing an annual tune-up on your AC unit:

Longer Lifespan: On average, an air conditioner lasts 10-20 years but some can last as long as 30 years. How long your system lasts totally depends on how well you maintain it.

If your AC doesn’t receive any care, it may not even last 10 years. And an older AC is very similar to an old car – both become less efficient and use more energy to operate.

Reduced Electricity Bills: With yearly maintenance, an AC unit is bound to perform more efficiently. This means lesser energy bills for you.

Fewer Repair Bills: Any problem that could potentially turn into a breakdown can be caught early and repaired by your service specialist.

Greater Comfort: When you are taking good care of your AC unit, you know that you can get the parts replaced before they wear out completely and damage the AC. This will give you peace of mind, knowing no huge repair/replacement bills are going to surprise you.

Keeping Your AC Unit Healthy Between Service Calls

In between the yearly tune-up visits, you can follow some tips to keep your cooling system running smoothly:

  •       When you are not home or out on a vacation, turn up the thermostat so as to lessen the load on your AC.
  •       Inspect the outdoor AC unit for damage every once in a while and keep the surrounding area free of debris, leaves, weeds, etc.
  •       If you notice any leaks, weird noises or sudden change in air temperature that doesn’t match the thermostat, call for AC repair technicians.
  •       Check the indoor air vents for any debris, dirt, or other obstructions and get them cleaned out on a monthly basis.

In addition, make sure you replace the air filters every month. If the filters get clogged with dirt and dust, your AC will need to work way harder to cool your home. This not only increases your utility bills but also damages the motor of the system.

Also, dirty air filters hold a lot of harmful contaminants that can compromise the indoor air quality. This can cause you and your family to suffer from flu, cold, or breathing issues.

Get Excellent AC Repair and Installation Services within 24 Hours

Is your AC unit behaving erratically? Do you think your home’s air quality is not what it used to be? This could be due to an old or damaged air conditioner. Call us toll-free at 800-399-4248 or write to us online for your AC repair or cleaning requirements.
